meanings.definition: A brief evocative description, account, or episode.
meanings.sent1: In her writing, she painted a vivid vignette of a sunny day at the park.
meanings.sent2: The author included a short vignette about a memorable encounter in the story.
meanings.sent3: The vignette about the clumsy puppy chasing its tail brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: His life felt like a series of vignettes, each capturing a different emotion or moment.
meanings.sent5: The vignette of the old man feeding pigeons in the square stayed with me long after I finished reading.

meanings.definition: A small illustration or portrait photograph that fades into its background without a definite border.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a beautiful vignette of a flower against a soft, blurred background.
meanings.sent2: She framed the family vignette in a delicate, ornate frame.
meanings.sent3: The vignette of the cat napping in the sun looked like a painting come to life.
meanings.sent4: Her smile in the photograph was a bright vignette against the dim background.
meanings.sent5: The vignette of the mountain peak against the sunset was breathtakingly beautiful.

meanings.definition: A decorative design or small illustration used on the title page of a book or at the beginning or end of a chapter.
meanings.sent1: The ornate vignette on the title page added a touch of elegance to the book.
meanings.sent2: Each chapter began with a unique vignette that hinted at what was to come.
meanings.sent3: The quirky vignette on the last page made readers chuckle as they closed the book.
meanings.sent4: The vignette of the rose on the cover was a subtle hint at the story's theme.
meanings.sent5: The intricate vignette on the title page drew readers into the world of the novel.
